anon_text.19: it looks like your /Users directory isn't getting mounted into the docker container correctly
anon_text.20: Im running docker through minikube right now
anon_text.22: No its not docker machine. Its whatever happens if I spin up minikube with xhyve
anon_text.24: yeah the xhyve driver doesn't have file sharing enabled right now
anon_text.25: so /Users on your mac won't get mapped into the VM
anon_text.27: Ill see if it works with the virtual box driver
anon_text.30: vbox performance is a lot better still

anon_text.42: afaik there's no basic auth like the clusters set up on gcloud. You may need to create a secret, unless minikube creates one for you
anon_text.43: If it's a token, you can add the auth header "Bearer TOKEN"
anon_text.44: If it's a crt you should be able to specify client cert to curl

anon_text.68: ah, i don't think that'll work yet in minikube
anon_text.69: we don't go through that flag parsing codepath
anon_text.71: you can probably use the vbox UI to switch the VM over to a different CIDR after starting it

anon_text.75: could you open a bug for us to add a flag for this?
anon_text.79: Hi there! Just getting started with k8s, and found out about minikube today - taking it for a spin. One road bump Ive encountered is that my client API version (1.24) is newer than the server API version (1.23). Im using the latest Docker for Mac from <http://docker.com|docker.com>.
anon_text.80: Whats the best way to resolve this? Should I expect a newer minikube release, or do I need to downgrade my docker client?
anon_text.81: (Im new to docker as well as k8s!)
anon_text.82: <@U1LLP308G>: (I'm a docker guy not a k8s guy) You couldn't be using the latest docker for mac as your server. It would have to be APIv1.24 if you were running 1.12
anon_text.83: My guess is you have an older virtualbox based VM around.
anon_text.84: somewhat related, I'm having a lot better luck with the minikube driver that uses xhyve rather than vbox.
anon_text.85: <@U11H6PJUB>: oh, could well be. I should do a clean out and start over.
anon_text.86: Ill switch to xhyve too (assume thats The Future?)
anon_text.88: <@U1LLP308G>: If you are on a mac, check out dvm
anon_text.91: lets you switch your docker version
anon_text.93: danfairs, try this in your command shell: ```export DOCKER_API_VERSION=1.23```

It looks like I have to comment this code to use the externally defined GOPAHT. Am I missing something or is the doc incomplete?

anon_text.112: can I switch virtualbox image network type to a LAN visible configuration?
anon_text.114: i need to expose my cluster to the offe LAN
anon_text.116: hey <@U12U3NGMT>, you only need a clean gopath to make godeps work right during the save/export cycle
anon_text.118: 1. make a clean gopath, put the minikube source in there
anon_text.119: 2. use godep restore ./... to fill in the rest of the gopath from vendor
anon_text.120: 3. "go get" the new import, and start using it in code
anon_text.121: at that point you can build stuff with just "go build" and "go test" to make sure it's all working
anon_text.122: 4. run godep save ./... to import the new package from your GOPATH into vendor
anon_text.123: <@U12U3NGMT>:  I'd be happy to help with that effort if you don't mind
anon_text.124: I'm quite interested in getting this to work from a windows workstation
